UnitType.Backstory:
These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. The air shrill derives its power from the Air Shard.
Their mandibles are potent magical reagents; practicing alchemists and wizards will pay top gildar for them.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. The air shrill derives its power from the Air Shard.
Their mandibles are potent magical reagents; practicing alchemists and wizards will pay top gildar for them.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. The air shrill derives its power from the Air Shard.
Their mandibles are potent magical reagents; practicing alchemists and wizards will pay top gildar for them.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. The air shrill derives its power from the Air Shard.
Their mandibles are potent magical reagents; practicing alchemists and wizards will pay top gildar for them.

Wargs are fell creatures, wolves mutated by dark magics thousands of years ago. They are stronger and more cunning than their non-magical counterparts. They prefer to hunt alone, and will fight over territory rather than ally themselves with their brethren.
Wind Wargs do not have the same propensity for violence as most Wargs, although they as dangerous as any. They are quick and evasive, possessing unnatural reaction times.

Wargs are fell creatures, wolves mutated by dark magics thousands of years ago. They are stronger and more cunning than their non-magical counterparts. They prefer to hunt alone, and will fight over territory rather than ally themselves with their brethren.
Wind Wargs do not have the same propensity for violence as most Wargs, although they as dangerous as any. They are quick and evasive, possessing unnatural reaction times.

Wargs are fell creatures, wolves mutated by dark magics thousands of years ago. They are stronger and more cunning than their non-magical counterparts. They prefer to hunt alone, and will fight over territory rather than ally themselves with their brethren.
Wind Wargs do not have the same propensity for violence as most Wargs, although they as dangerous as any. They are quick and evasive, possessing unnatural reaction times.

Pack Drakes are to the Great Drakes as those creatures are to Dragons; smaller, less powerful, but still unwise to underestimate. Though Pack Drakes do possess an animal cunning, they lack the savage intelligence of their greater cousins. They behave, rather, like wolves, forming territorial packs that defend their territory.
The rarer "Storm" Pack Drake tends to be larger than the common Pack Drake, and can release a charge of static energy, causing lightning damage to adjacent opponents.

Pack Drakes are to the Great Drakes as those creatures are to Dragons; smaller, less powerful, but still unwise to underestimate. Though Pack Drakes do possess an animal cunning, they lack the savage intelligence of their greater cousins. They behave, rather, like wolves, forming territorial packs that defend their territory.
The rarer "Storm" Pack Drake tends to be larger than the common Pack Drake, and can release a charge of static energy, causing lightning damage to adjacent opponents.

UnitType.Quote: Do not mistake me for a gentle midsummer breeze; I am the howl of destruction...
UnitType.Backstory: In the time before this one - before the coming of the Titans, before the Cataclysm that sundered the world - lesser Elementals such as these served as attendants to Elemental Lords, those who men worshipped as the Five of Anthuane. These creatures were called Anathua for this reason; they were thought to be the physical manifestation of the magic of the shards, which they were never far from. That time has passed. The Lesser Elementals know no allegiance now; they are as likely as not to attack without warning.
The proud warrior Storm Giants can be found in the highest mountaints. They can harness the electrical energy from the air to call lightning bolts upon their enemies.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. The Earth shrill derives its power from the Earth Shard.
Their mandibles are potent magical reagents; practicing alchemists and wizards will pay top gildar for them.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. The Earth shrill derives its power from the Earth Shard.
Their mandibles are potent magical reagents; practicing alchemists and wizards will pay top gildar for them.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. The Earth shrill derives its power from the Earth Shard.
Their mandibles are potent magical reagents; practicing alchemists and wizards will pay top gildar for them.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. The Earth shrill derives its power from the Earth Shard.
Their mandibles are potent magical reagents; practicing alchemists and wizards will pay top gildar for them.

Within the third quarto of the Varis Reliquaria is contained the spell Anima Tsal Animana - life from lifelessness. This incantation, first mastered by Ereog in his time of solitude, imbues stone with the semblance of life.
This same spell is believed to animate the Sand Golems that wander the wastelands, which are believed to have been created by forces loyal to the Lady Umber in the time immediately before the great Cataclysm, for some dark purpose that was never fulfilled.
When a Sand Golem is destroyed it reverts back to the rock and sand it was prior to enchantment.

Within the third quarto of the Varis Reliquaria is contained the spell Anima Tsal Animana - life from lifelessness. This incantation, first mastered by Ereog in his time of solitude, imbues stone with the semblance of life.
This same spell is believed to animate the Sand Golems that wander the wastelands, which are believed to have been created by forces loyal to the Lady Umber in the time immediately before the great Cataclysm, for some dark purpose that was never fulfilled.
When a Sand Golem is destroyed it reverts back to the rock and sand it was prior to enchantment.

Within the third quarto of the Varis Reliquaria is contained the spell Anima Tsal Animana - life from lifelessness. This incantation, first mastered by Ereog in his time of solitude, imbues stone with the semblance of life.
This same spell is believed to animate the Sand Golems that wander the wastelands, which are believed to have been created by forces loyal to the Lady Umber in the time immediately before the great Cataclysm, for some dark purpose that was never fulfilled.
When a Sand Golem is destroyed it reverts back to the rock and sand it was prior to enchantment.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call.
The Crag shrill is larger and more dangerous thost most forms of shrill.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call.
The Crag shrill is larger and more dangerous thost most forms of shrill.

UnitType.Quote: When the earth rises, you would do well to fear.
UnitType.Backstory:
In the time before this one - before the coming of the Titans, before the Cataclysm that sundered the world - lesser Elementals such as these served as attendants to Elemental Lords, those who men worshipped as the Five of Anthuane. These creatures were called Anathua for this reason; they were thought to be the physical manifestation of the magic of the shards, which they were never far from. That time has passed. The Lesser Elementals know no allegiance now; they are as likely as not to attack without warning.
Earth Elementals are immune to all poisons of this world.

UnitType.Quote: When the earth rises, you would do well to fear...
UnitType.Backstory:
The creatures known as Crag Spawn appear to be a variety of Earth Elemental; less powerful but more prone to violence than their larger cousins. They hate men, especially miners, and are fond of collapsing mines by destroying the tunnel braces. They then use the miners' picks and hammers to pull bones out of the trapped miners in a gross parody of the miners' work. For these reasons, some have speculated that these creatures were created by Morrigan, or his allies among the Fallen.
The Crag Lord is the largest of the Crag Spawn.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. Though they aren't powerful attackers, their ability to summon torrents of fire can be devastating if they aren't dealt with quickly.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. Though they aren't powerful attackers, their ability to summon torrents of fire can be devastating if they aren't dealt with quickly.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. Though they aren't powerful attackers, their ability to summon torrents of fire can be devastating if they aren't dealt with quickly.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. Though they aren't powerful attackers, their ability to summon torrents of fire can be devastating if they aren't dealt with quickly.

Ignys - also called Delinaja, or Ash Serpents by some - are kin to the Lesser Fire Elementals. They are usually found nesting near areas of intense heat, such as volcanic rifts, or Fire Shard sanctuaries. In their, normal, quiescent state, they are cool and nearly invisible... but when irritated, they will glow and burst into flames.

Ignys - also called Delinaja, or Ash Serpents by some - are kin to the Lesser Fire Elementals. They are usually found nesting near areas of intense heat, such as volcanic rifts, or Fire Shard sanctuaries. In their, normal, quiescent state, they are cool and nearly invisible... but when irritated, they will glow and burst into flames.

Ignys - also called Delinaja, or Ash Serpents by some - are kin to the Lesser Fire Elementals. They are usually found nesting near areas of intense heat, such as volcanic rifts, or Fire Shard sanctuaries. In their, normal, quiescent state, they are cool and nearly invisible... but when irritated, they will glow and burst into flames.

The Inferno Spider is one of many strange perversions of nature that appeared after the Cataclysm. They are a large wicked arachnid, possessing an extraordinary abdomen that constantly smolders in flame. The Inferno Spider does not use a web or poison but can evoke a burst of flame that engulfs surrounding enemies.

The Inferno Spider is one of many strange perversions of nature that appeared after the Cataclysm. They are a large wicked arachnid, possessing an extraordinary abdomen that constantly smolders in flame. The Inferno Spider does not use a web or poison but can evoke a burst of flame that engulfs surrounding enemies.

UnitType.Quote: You attempt to enslave the power of elemental, but I will not be bound. Come within my reach and I will burn you to nothing more than a darkened husk.
UnitType.Backstory:
In the time before this one - before the coming of the Titans, before the Cataclysm that sundered the world - lesser Elementals such as these served as attendants to Elemental Lords, those who men worshipped as the Five of Anthuane. These creatures were called Anathua for this reason; they were thought to be the physical manifestation of the magic of the shards, which they were never far from. That time has passed. The Lesser Elementals know no allegiance now; they are as likely as not to attack without warning.
The Fire Elemental's weakness is cold; it is said to be immune to all poisons, and invulnerable to flame as well.
The Cacus Giant is a fearsome giant with the innate ability to invoke a devastating burst of fire. Found in mountainous and volcanic regions, they are fortunately rarely encountered.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. The water shrill derives its power from the Water Shard.
Their mandibles are potent magical reagents; practicing alchemists and wizards will pay top gildar for them.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. The water shrill derives its power from the Water Shard.
Their mandibles are potent magical reagents; practicing alchemists and wizards will pay top gildar for them.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. The water shrill derives its power from the Water Shard.
Their mandibles are potent magical reagents; practicing alchemists and wizards will pay top gildar for them.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call. The water shrill derives its power from the Water Shard.
Their mandibles are potent magical reagents; practicing alchemists and wizards will pay top gildar for them.

No serpent hates men as much as these, for the Naja were bred within N'it'Vaganesh as living weapons. They can grow to three times a man's length, with fangs as long and sharp as short swords.
The River Naja is not venomous, however it has a strong bite and an unnaturally fast attack.

No serpent hates men as much as these, for the Naja were bred within N'it'Vaganesh as living weapons. They can grow to three times a man's length, with fangs as long and sharp as short swords.
The River Naja is not venomous, however it has a strong bite and an unnaturally fast attack.

No serpent hates men as much as these, for the Naja were bred within N'it'Vaganesh as living weapons. They can grow to three times a man's length, with fangs as long and sharp as short swords.
The River Naja is not venomous, however it has a strong bite and an unnaturally fast attack.

The Sea Skath is one of the largest and most intelligent of the Skath species. Sea Skaths take advantage of the easy meals provided by the nets of careless fisherman. Many fishing vessels have been overturned by these beasts, who never pass at the chance to dine on the floundering crew.
Skath Fins are rare indeed and can be sold to merchants for a hefty amount of gildar.

The Sea Skath is one of the largest and most intelligent of the Skath species. Sea Skaths take advantage of the easy meals provided by the nets of careless fisherman. Many fishing vessels have been overturned by these beasts, who never pass at the chance to dine on the floundering crew.
Skath Fins are rare indeed and can be sold to merchants for a hefty amount of gildar.

UnitType.Quote: There is more to fear than the cold in the arctic...
UnitType.Backstory:
In the time before this one - before the coming of the Titans, before the Cataclysm that sundered the world - lesser Elementals such as these served as attendants to the Elemental Lords, those who men worshipped as the Five of Anthuane. These creatures were called Anathua for this reason; they were thought to be the physical manifestation of the magic of the shards, which they were never far from. That time has passed. The Lesser Elementals know no allegiance now; they are as likely as not to attack without warning.
The Ice Elemental's weakness is fire; it is immune to cold, and all poisons of the world as well.
Oceanborn are tall amphibious humanoids. These "water giants" are now such a rare sight that they are in fact believed to be a creature of folklore.

The Blink Dog is a rarely sighted magical canine that possess a unique ability to teleport short distances. They are intelligent, making loyal companions and allies. Although a peaceful creature they are quick to defend themselves when threatened.

The Blink Dog is a rarely sighted magical canine that possess a unique ability to teleport short distances. They are intelligent, making loyal companions and allies. Although a peaceful creature they are quick to defend themselves when threatened.

The Blink Dog is a rarely sighted magical canine that possess a unique ability to teleport short distances. They are intelligent, making loyal companions and allies. Although a peaceful creature they are quick to defend themselves when threatened.

The Blink Dog is a rarely sighted magical canine that possess a unique ability to teleport short distances. They are intelligent, making loyal companions and allies. Although a peaceful creature they are quick to defend themselves when threatened.
The Celestial Defender is the line soldier of the Celestial Heavens, a devoted guardian of all that is good.
The Celestial Defender is the line soldier of the Celestial Heavens, a devoted guardian of all that is good.
The Celestial Defender is the line soldier of the Celestial Heavens, a devoted guardian of all that is good.

These great cats are solitary hunters, with an uncanny ability to target the weakest member within any group - be it wolf pack, trading caravan, or fighting army - and make a quick kill of them. Recall Erwynn's tale of the Princess's Pet, and the fate of Duke Prandir, who was chased across the deserts of Lombard to his death.

These great cats are solitary hunters, with an uncanny ability to target the weakest member within any group - be it wolf pack, trading caravan, or fighting army - and make a quick kill of them. Recall Erwynn's tale of the Princess's Pet, and the fate of Duke Prandir, who was chased across the deserts of Lombard to his death.

Within the third quarto of the Varis Reliquaria is contained the spell Anima Tsal Animana - life from lifelessness. This incantation, first mastered by Ereog in his time of solitude, imbues stone with the semblance of life, creating creatures that have come to be known as golems.
The simpler golems are controlled by the channeler who creates them, and will return to an inert state if the Channeler is killed or is otherwise unable to maintain control.
When a Golem is destroyed, it reverts back to the normal rock it was prior to enchantment.
Archons are powerful elementals serving in the armies of the forces of good. These celestial beings are unrelenting in their battle evil.

The Shadowed Sepulcher started as a low, swampy field around a sharp edged stone nearly the size of a wagon. Nothing grew in the field and the ground was too soft to support building so the people of Millis Mor made it into their graveyard. Animals avoid the area and it was quiet, somber and unsettling. The land was so soft that grave markers disappeared into the ground within a few years of being placed.
Some complained that the dismal field is no place for the honored dead. But more valuable land was claimed for new farms, homes or markets in the growing village. Because the grave markers disappeared into the ground old sections of the field would open up for a new generation of memories, tears and bodies.
Until that autumn night when the resurrection failed. Many speculated that only those that were troubled or cruel in life rose. But it was the lingering spirits of demons that animated them. And that great twisted stone at the center of the Shadowed Sepulcher was a death shard, a prison of corrupted magic and whispering demons. The demons called to the dead of Millis Mor, to the dead of villages past that had been built at that site, and those that had been sacrificed there long ago when the site was a temple to the cult of a hundred eyes.
And the dead poured out of the soft ground. Together they swept into Millis Mor, captured every citizen and dragged them back to the Shadowed Sepulcher and buried them alive and screaming in the soft ground.
Now the village lies empty and inviting. There is no sign or trouble, only empty buildings and overgrown fields that could be repaired with little work. And any who resettled the village would find it a good home for most of the year. Until that autumn night came again, and the demons called for the dead to bring their sacrifice. In the morning the village would be empty again, and another generation of bodies would be added to the Shadowed Sepulcher.

The people of Anniellum screamed as the sky exploded and fire, lava and ash rained down on them. They screamed as they fled burning homes, as they saw the horror of charred corpses before them. They screamed as Delin, the Pyre of Man, loomed over them, as he summoned new waves of flame down on the city, and as it consumed their flesh.
Their screams continue as they lumber out of the ruins of Anniellum, burning spirits held together by pain, fire and cruel hunger.

The people of Anniellum screamed as the sky exploded and fire, lava and ash rained down on them. They screamed as they fled burning homes, as they saw the horror of charred corpses before them. They screamed as Delin, the Pyre of Man, loomed over them, as he summoned new waves of flame down on the city, and as it consumed their flesh.
Their screams continue as they lumber out of the ruins of Anniellum, burning spirits held together by pain, fire and cruel hunger.

The people of Anniellum screamed as the sky exploded and fire, lava and ash rained down on them. They screamed as they fled burning homes, as they saw the horror of charred corpses before them. They screamed as Delin, the Pyre of Man, loomed over them, as he summoned new waves of flame down on the city, and as it consumed their flesh.
Their screams continue as they lumber out of the ruins of Anniellum, burning spirits held together by pain, fire and cruel hunger.

These are smaller and quicker than the typical Poison Spider, but their venom is just as potent. They are called 'Corpse Spiders' because they feed on the dead and rotting flesh of their victims.
Corpse Spiders hold more individual Venom Glands than Poison Spiders, which makes them a favored target for adventurers seeking such glands for alchemical purposes or sale.

These are smaller and quicker than the typical Poison Spider, but their venom is just as potent. They are called 'Corpse Spiders' because they feed on the dead and rotting flesh of their victims.
Corpse Spiders hold more individual Venom Glands than Poison Spiders, which makes them a favored target for adventurers seeking such glands for alchemical purposes or sale.

It was Curgen's brother, the Drednir known as Kir-Tion, who first summoned these creatures (known variously as Drednii, or Demons) to Elemental. Upon the very altar where Josryn the Elder received Great Ereog's blessing, Kir-Tion first bound and then sacrificed the Princess Lansa to open a portal to the outer planes... and through that portal came these monsters and their brethren (it should be noted that there are some channelers who believe that the Drednii are simply death magic made flesh, and not separate, sentient creatures). All demons draw their strength from devouring the life-force of other beings.

UnitType.Quote: I feed on death and blood.
UnitType.Backstory:
It was Curgen's brother, the Drednir known as Kir-Tion, who first summoned these creatures (known variously as Drednii, or Demons) to Elemental. Upon the very altar where Josryn the Elder received Great Ereog's blessing, Kir-Tion first bound and then sacrificed the Princess Lansa to open a portal to the outer planes... and through that portal came these monsters and their brethren (it should be noted that there are some channelers who believe that the Drednii are simply death magic made flesh, and not separate, sentient creatures). All demons draw their strength from devouring the life-force of other beings.
The horns of these creatures are often used in various alchemical remedies and magical experiments, and are extremely valuable.
The Windwalkers ability to control the winds can be invaluable assitance to an army.

UnitType.Quote: Created to Destroy, I await one powerful enough to serve.
UnitType.Backstory:
It is believed that the Anima Tsa Animana - the spell of life from lifelessness - animates these, the rarest of Elemental's golems, though some among the Padars say that it is the soul of a once-living being that inhabits these creatures. Crafted from volcanic glass or lava rock, these creatures are most often found among the ruins of the great cities of man, though from time to time they are uncovered in more unusual locales.
When an Obsidian Golem is destroyed it reverts back to the lava rock it was prior to enchantment.
The Flame Spawn is a walking inferno - it knows only to burn.
The Undine are powerful water spirits - mythical beings that guarded lakes, pools and waterfalls.
Beware, the demonic beach ball of doom that is the Abhorrent Dretch.
The Spirit Wolf is a celestial guardian that is known to assist lost or endangered adventurers and travellers.

In desperate times greater archons have been known to take possession of an elemental being, combining the power of the elemental with the archon's divine might. The process is dangerous and in most circumstances, cannot be undone.

It was Curgen's brother, the Drednir known as Kir-Tion, who first summoned these creatures (known variously as Drednii, or Demons) to Elemental. Upon the very altar where Josryn the Elder received Great Ereog's blessing, Kir-Tion first bound and then sacrificed the Princess Lansa to open a portal to the outer planes... and through that portal came these monsters and their brethren (it should be noted that there are some channelers who believe that the Drednii are simply death magic made flesh, and not separate, sentient creatures). All demons draw their strength from devouring the life-force of other beings.
The Bane Wyrm heralds the coming of darkness, as it is often found at the vanguard of a Drednii legion.

It was Curgen's brother, the Drednir known as Kir-Tion, who first summoned these creatures (known variously as Drednii, or Demons) to Elemental. Upon the very altar where Josryn the Elder received Great Ereog's blessing, Kir-Tion first bound and then sacrificed the Princess Lansa to open a portal to the outer planes... and through that portal came these monsters and their brethren (it should be noted that there are some channelers who believe that the Drednii are simply death magic made flesh, and not separate, sentient creatures). All demons draw their strength from devouring the life-force of other beings.
"Hazu Bah'kehga" is it's drednii name, "Defiler" as known to men... this infernal creature leads the armies of darkness into battle.

UnitType.Quote: I feed on death and thrive on sorrow.
UnitType.Backstory:
It was Curgen's brother, the Drednir known as Kir-Tion, who first summoned these creatures (known variously as Drednii, or Demons) to Elemental. Upon the very altar where Josryn the Elder received Great Ereog's blessing, Kir-Tion first bound and then sacrificed the Princess Lansa to open a portal to the outer planes... and through that portal came these monsters and their brethren (it should be noted that there are some channelers who believe that the Drednii are simply death magic made flesh, and not separate, sentient creatures). All demons draw their strength from devouring the life-force of other beings.
The horns of these creatures are often used in various alchemical remedies and magical experiments, and are extremely valuable.

These massive creatures - called Great Drakes by Ezmir in his account of the Long March - are the most powerful of the Dragon's Kin; incredibly powerful, often greatly intelligent beings, they differ from their more powerful cousins in one crucial respect: they possess no inherent magical powers. The story of Magor the Red, in Erwynn's tales, is said to be an apocryphal retelling of their origin - how Magor, blinded by his desire for the Jewels of Az-Adoras, allowed himself to be trapped by the Dark Prince and ensorcelled into surrendering the magics that were part of his very essence.
The Great Drake has a nigh-impenetrable scale coat and teeth powerful and sharp enough to cut through the toughest steel with ease. Capable of breathing fire, these creatures are drawn to things of magic and make their lairs near shards or magical ruins.

UnitType.Quote: My master is long gone; those who remain are beneath my disdain.
UnitType.Backstory:
These monsters were created by Morrigan, in the depths of N'it'Vaganesh, to rule over the lesser Shrills the Patricide had summoned into existence. They earn their name from the paralyzing shriek they emit in combat. On Morrigan's death, the Shrill Lords scattered to the far reaches of the world... only a few are known to remain.
As is the case with the lesser Shrills, the mandibles of the Shrill Lord are rich in magical reagents. Alchemists as well as channelers will pay a hefty price for them.

UnitType.Quote: And the battalions of man became dust.
UnitType.Backstory:
After building the Forge of the Overlord a storm raged in the skies over Verhallaem for 10 days, a storm without clouds, but with immense lightning, thunder and rain. During the storm dragons dove out of the sky, as blue as cobalt and the air echoed with their cries of pain, panic and anger.
On the morning of the eleventh day Pariden stood in the Forge of the Overlord and the world went silent. The storm had ended and the dragons were gone. These types of dragons had never been seen in Elemental prior to that storm and even now they live apart from the others. Like most dragons they consider men to be little more than insects scurrying on the face of Elemental, but they will at times speak to men and may even accept tokens of appeasement or worship.

UnitType.Quote: I will drag you down into endless night and devour your power, your soul and when there is nothing left but sorrow, your body.
UnitType.Backstory:
"I stood at the chasm's edge and listened to the whispers of the world below. I saw the place where night escapes when morning comes, and where fear lingers, waiting for the darkness to return." � The Oracle Ceresa at the Aphotic Throne, the ancient nest of the Fell Dragons.
All dragons are terrible and powerful. All dragons hate the men that have stolen and ruined their world. But Fell Dragons are darker still. They seek the annilation of men, and their desire is so great that they are willing to debase themselves to accomplish it. They will join with the Fallen, pretend to unite with those that would command them, so that they can encourage war, so that they can taste flesh, and so that they can hope for a time when a single battle calls all the lesser creatures of the world into a great war. And in that time, when the empires are at their greatest need, when they call upon the Fell Dragons for aide, no one knows if the dragons will come.

Sprites are diminutive forest dwelling creatures that can be found in Mushroom Groves. They are known to some as forest mites, however they are in fact not related to Mites and other than a similar outward appearance they have nothing in common.
Sprites are reclusive creatures and difficult to negotiate with. They avoid both men and fallen where possible - preferring the company of woodland creatures. Although physically very weak, they tend to be found in large groups and have several magical abilities including strong spell resistance that can make them frustrating to deal with when encountered.

These giant wasps are extremely fast and have a toxic piercing attack. They will usually avoid contact with anything larger than themselves, however if provoked, they are highly agressive.
These giant wasps are extremely fast and have a toxic piercing attack. They will usually avoid contact with anything larger than themselves, however if provoked, they are highly agressive.
These giant wasps are extremely fast and have a toxic piercing attack. They will usually avoid contact with anything larger than themselves, however if provoked, they are highly agressive.

Normally reclusive and mild-tempered, bears are territorial creatures, and relentless when disturbed. Despite their nature, their sheer size and strength make them deadly.
Recall the story of Samman the Gentle Bear, in Erwynn's Tales, and how he pursued the Bandit Boy of Amin Fer all across the plains of Engar to retrieve the berries the boy had stolen from him. The wise traveler learns to avoid the forest and hillsides these creatures call home.

Normally reclusive and mild-tempered, bears are territorial creatures, and relentless when disturbed. Despite their nature, their sheer size and strength make them deadly.
Recall the story of Samman the Gentle Bear, in Erwynn's Tales, and how he pursued the Bandit Boy of Amin Fer all across the plains of Engar to retrieve the berries the boy had stolen from him. The wise traveler learns to avoid the forest and hillsides these creatures call home.

Sometimes called tree-kin, the reclusive forest guardians are generally peaceful creatures. They generally do not stray far from their forest homes, preferably not to get involved with the affairs of others. When disturbed however, or if their beloved forests are threatened, they can be quick to anger and will readily go to battle.

UnitType.Quote: You would do well to leave me be.
UnitType.Backstory: In the time before this one - before the coming of the Titans, before the Cataclysm that sundered the world - lesser Elementals such as these served as attendants to Elemental Lords, those who men worshipped as the Five of Anthuane. These creatures were called Anathua for this reason; they were thought to be the physical manifestation of the magic of the shards, which they were never far from. That time has passed. The Lesser Elementals know no allegiance now; they are as likely as not to attack without warning.

Wargs are fell creatures, wolves mutated by dark magics thousands of years ago. They are stronger and more cunning than their non-magical counterparts. They prefer to hunt alone, and will fight over territory rather than ally themselves with their brethren.
The Shadow Warg is the largest and most powerful of the breed; it is often domesticated by the many subspecies of Fallen - Urxen, Quendar, etc. - and used as a mount in combat.

Though the Titans brought death magic to this world, it was the Empress Ceresa who mastered it. She used these energies to corrupt and transform the minor Elementals of this world, twisting their powers to suit her own needs.
According to Ezmir, Cyndrum was the most heavily guarded of all entrances to N'it'Vaganesh - the laboratory of the damned, where first Curgen and then Morrigan the Mad made monsters from the creatures of Elemental. These demons are said to have been fashioned by Ceresa using the arcane tools she found in Cyndrum's ruins. For every soldier they kill, demons summoned in this manner are able to add another of their own kind to their forces.

The Nightwing is often called to the material world by dark wizards and other masters of the black arts, frequently used for guarding treasure or support during combat.
The Nightwing is often called to the material world by dark wizards and other masters of the black arts, frequently used for guarding treasure or support during combat.
Reclusive, defensive, brutally powerful, this monster is extremely territorial and violently aggressive. The Cave Hoarder is an intelligent creature possessing mind bending spell like powers.

These are the domesticated cousins of those wolves that haunt the wild north. First tamed by the tribes of the Nimer, these animals are loyal to a fault, and quite dangerous to anyone who threatens their master.

These are the domesticated cousins of those wolves that haunt the wild north. First tamed by the tribes of the Nimer, these animals are loyal to a fault, and quite dangerous to anyone who threatens their master.

Stone guardians are found protecting tombs and treasures.
Stone guardians are found protecting tombs and treasures.
A mighty champion from a long forgotten time.

UnitType.Description: There are few creatures on Elemental that are able to withstand more damage than a War Golem. Long have they stood silent, patient sentry over their charges.
UnitType.Backstory: These are creatures forged of mana and metal; beings who can be summoned into existence only by those possessing the blood of the Aivernach - the Iron Tribes of old. An Iron Golem can wield any weapon given to it, and is a master of defense; long after the last men of Aivern fell to the hordes of Meergas Maz Adul's Nerazga, its Iron Golems remained, stalwart protectors of the city walls.

In Erwynn's Tales, wolves are often found as companions of men. As far back as the Age of the Magi, there are stories of wolf packs accompanying the great armies of men to war. Now though, in the aftermath of the cataclysm, their natural prey has become scarce, and these creatures must be regarded as dangerous by all who encounter them.
Wolf pelts remain rare enough that merchants are still willing to pay a fair price for them.

These great cats are solitary hunters, with an uncanny ability to target the weakest member within any group - be it wolf pack, trading caravan, or fighting army - and make a quick kill of them. Recall Erwynn's tale of the Princess's Pet, and the fate of Duke Prandir, who was chased across the deserts of Lombard to his death.

Recall Erwynn's tale of the Princess's Pet, and the fate of Duke Prandir, who was chased across the deserts of Lombard to his death.

Wild Boars are still relatively common in Elemental even post cataclysm. They seemingly possessing a knack for survival through difficult conditions, surely helped by their willingness to eat pretty much anything... or anyone.

Wild Boars are still relatively common in Elemental even post cataclysm. They seemingly possessing a knack for survival through difficult conditions, surely helped by their willingness to eat pretty much anything... or anyone.

Native to the high mountain reaches, the cave bear is one of the largest - and deadliest - creatures in all the world. Some believe these animals evolved naturally; others believe that they were bred by Morrigan in the depths of N'it'Vaganesh. Despite (or perhaps because of) their size, there are numerous recorded instances of these bears being trapped when young and subsequently raised as servants. They are quite trainable, albeit very destructive.

Most Hergon are herd animals, males and females grouping together. In some case however, overly aggressive young males are displaced from the herd by the older males. These Rogue Hergon usually end up as Troll food in short time, however in some cases a particularly large and intelligent Rogue will thrive on it's own. These Hergon can outlive their herd dwelling counterparts, growing to much larger sizes and developing an aggressive nature that makes them a terrifying but fortunately rare encounter.
The Hyleoroi or "watcher of the woods" is a female nature spirit that serves to protect the forests and it's inhabitants.
Black Horror.

Sages say the Ophidian were once great pythons, related to the bonefield morelia, but they were changed after generations of nesting near crystal deposits. Those crystals became embedded in their scales. The Ophidian are now over twice as long as their ancestors, and immune to spells. Their bite causes a feeling of numbness and euphoria in the victim; a sensation that helps numb the horror of being swallowed whole.
Those brave enough to capture or kill Ophidian can make a great deal of money selling their scales to enchanters and their venom to those of less repute.
